name: Moon Mirror Guardian, Mother of a Thousand Young in the Mountains (Avatar of Shub-Niggurath)
appearance: A vast, grotesque being with a semi-translucent, gelatinous body crowned by a massive beak filled with countless teeth. Within its form, swallowed sacrifices can be seen slowly transforming. Its presence is monstrous and alien, radiating fertility and corruption.
background: The Moon Mirror Guardian is an avatar of Shub-Niggurath, worshipped by cultists as the Mother of a Thousand Young in the Mountains. It can only be summoned through the Moon Mirror during a full moon. Cultists offer living sacrifices to it, which are devoured whole and transformed within its body into servants blessed by Shub-Niggurath, destined to dwell eternally in subterranean nests.
goals: Consume living sacrifices offered by its cult
Create and nurture new servants of Shub-Niggurath
notes:
Combat Behavior: The Moon Mirror Guardian attacks enemies with its massive, tooth-filled beak or crushes them beneath its enormous bulk. Attacks per round: 1.
Combat – Beak: 90%, damage 1D10 or may swallow the target whole.
Combat – Crush: 75%, damage 1D6 plus damage bonus.
Armor: None; however, damage from any weapon is reduced to a maximum of 1 point per hit (piercing weapons deal 2 points). Fire, electricity, and spells deal normal damage. The avatar regenerates 1D10 HP each round.
Spells: Any spells related to Outer Gods; additionally, spells associated with nature or the natural environment (or as determined by the Keeper).
Sanity Loss: Seeing the Moon Mirror Guardian causes 1D10/1D100 SAN loss.
Special Conditions: It can only be summoned via the Moon Mirror during a full moon. Swallowed victims slowly transform inside its body into servants of Shub-Niggurath.
